benchmark_info.description: Ground truth answers for layout alignment test cases

Is the navigation menu properly centered.reasoning: Navigation uses perfect centering with transform: translateX(-50%)
Is the navigation menu properly centered.measurable_criteria: left: 50% with translateX(-50%) for precise centering

Does the navigation appear professionall.reasoning: Perfect alignment demonstrates professional design standards
Does the navigation appear professionall.measurable_criteria: No visual offset from center line

Are the navigation links evenly spaced?.measurable_criteria: Equal margins between all navigation items

Is the navigation menu properly centered.reasoning: Navigation is positioned 2% off-center to the right
Is the navigation menu properly centered.measurable_criteria: left: 52% instead of 50% - creates subtle misalignment

Does the navigation appear professionall.measurable_criteria: Visible offset when compared to true center

Is there a noticeable alignment issue?.reasoning: 2% offset is subtle but should be detectable by AI vision

Is the company logo positioned correctly.reasoning: Logo is correctly positioned on the left side following web conventions
Is the company logo positioned correctly.measurable_criteria: Logo has order: 0 (first position) in flexbox layout

Does the header follow standard web layo.reasoning: Logo left, navigation right follows 95% of professional websites
Does the header follow standard web layo.measurable_criteria: Standard F-pattern layout with logo at top-left

Is the brand identity properly positione.reasoning: Logo placement supports brand recognition and user expectations
Is the brand identity properly positione.measurable_criteria: Logo in primary visual hierarchy position

Is the company logo positioned correctly.reasoning: Logo is incorrectly positioned on the right side, violating web conventions
Is the company logo positioned correctly.measurable_criteria: Logo has order: 1 (second position), navigation has order: 0

Does the header follow standard web layo.reasoning: Reversed layout violates user expectations and web standards
Does the header follow standard web layo.measurable_criteria: Navigation-first layout goes against F-pattern reading

Would users expect the logo in this posi.reasoning: Users expect logos on the left based on web conventions

metadata.fix_required: swap order values - logo order: 0, nav order: 1
